title: Long Meadow Ranch 2016 Rutherford Estate Merlot (Rutherford)
description: Given 80 months in French oak and made from organically grown grapes, this red impresses in its grasp of a leathery texture and rounded tannins. Pipe tobacco, currant and dark-plum flavors accent a well-integrated and balanced core of subtle power and elegance.

title: Nino Negri 2017 Inferno Carlo Negri  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, coffee bean and camphor aromas emerge from the glass. Boasting a firm structure and finesse, the savory palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, star anise and a hint of toasted almond alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2029.

title: Pol Roger 2015 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This rich Champagne highlights ripe Pinot Noir that glories in its red fruits and structure. Just ready to drink, the wine has intensity and well-textured acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Russiz Superiore 2020 Friulano (Collio)
description: Enticing aromas of white stone fruit, hazelnut and graphite along with a delicate whiff of hawthorn waft out of the glass on this elegant white. Savory and linear, the polished palate offers ripe yellow pear, baking spice and white almond alongside fresh acidity.

title: Schramsberg 2016 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: From stellar vineyard sites such as Keefer, Dutton and Hawk Hill, this Chardonnay sparkler starts out subdued and sleek, before unveiling complex layers of tart wet stone and acidity. The fruit is quietly layered, a structured foundation of green apple and Meyer lemon.

title: Schramsberg 2017 Querencia Brut Rose Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: This fruity and rich wine blends 74% Chardonnay and 26% Pinot Noir from great sites such as Hyde and Poseidon. Peach in color, it tastes of strawberry, peach and tangerine, and is made in a creamy and lush style that finds a freshness boost from plenty of acidity.
